About the Senior Product Data Analyst Position

Verndale lives at the intersection of cutting-edge digital marketing technology and award-winning user experience and our goal is to use that knowledge to benefit all of our clients. The Product Data Services team is instrumental in driving this forward with our PIM projects. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Senior Product Data Analyst to join our team on this exciting journey!

Responsibilities:

In this role, you will be responsible for the oversight and leadership of successful Product Data strategies, solutions and client projects within the PDS practice.

Organize, facilitate, and inform any PIM selection activities including RFI/P's.Organize, plan and facilitate discovery, design, and implementation activities with PDS clients and members of Verndale PDS team.Consult, inform and engage internal, external and client resources in understanding and presenting appropriate options, new and complex paradigms and other options needed to inform necessary scope and business decisions. Provide input and direction to other Verndale/PDS team members to enable their successful contribution aligned to the strategist's experience and solutionAssist Practice Director with practice development

Within client project delivery, the Senior Product Data Analyst is responsible for leading, strategizing and providing team direction for:

Pre-workshop and early engagement preparations and planningWorkshop facilitation and collaboration across PIM projectsOrganizing and mapping client PDS solution needs to be captured in project requirements and technical implementation documentationData Modeling & TaxonomyUser/Admin WorkflowPrint & Additional channel PIM applicationCustomization(s) necessary to complete client solutionsTeam estimations for all project phases of engagement across methodologyImplementation guidance to the larger PDS team as aligned with strategy and vision for optimized solution

Qualifications

5-7 years of demonstrated experience leading and delivering Product Data and Product Information Management solutions/projects8-10 years of professional services and consultative experienceStrong leadership and consultative delivery skills including:


Enterprise Product Data Strategy and multi-phase roadmapsExecutive and Team-Level client facilitation and communicationTechnical and internal delivery-team mentorship and communicationSolution development, scope definition and solution estimation

About Verndale

Verndale is a customer experience agency, purpose-built to help marketing and technology leaders connect the dots of the consumer journey. From our offices in Boston, Los Angeles and Quito, we design and build digital experiences, and enable marketing technologies that bring brands and their customers closer together.

We know that in order to do great work, you have to make work great. Verndale is committed to always being a company that celebrates diversity, equality and inclusion. Verndales services are built around a core methodology that encompasses Growth Strategy, Experience Design, Technology Enablement, and Experience Optimization.

We are Relativity. A market-leading, global tech company that equips legal and compliance professionals with a powerful platform to organize data, discover the truth, and act on it.  The US Department of Justice, 199 of the Am Law 200, and more than 329,000 enabled users trust Relativity during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects. Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.  We believe that great talent is not bound by geography and that what you do matters more than where you do it. Relativity has assumed a hybrid work strategy, allowing choice and flexibility for employees to work either from home, a physical Relativity office location (once safe to do so), or a combination of the two, within certain logistical boundaries. Submit your application to learn more from our recruiters or contact us for more details.  The Technical Business Analyst with DevEx acts as an advocate for developers creating solutions on top of the Relativity Platform. This position works directly with our external developer community, ensuring the best possible development experience on the Relativity Platform. Utilization of general software development knowledge, Relativity development best practices and customer facing skills will be combined to investigate areas of impact for customizations built for RelativityOne as well as Relativity Server. Responsibilities:Work with external developers to drive adoption and utilization of the Relativity platform within their organization Maintain technical understanding of the capabilities of our Relativity API’s and Platform while clearly communicating the benefits with our customers. Guides our customer’s designs and implementation decisions when developing on the Relativity Platform. Collaborate with developers to resolve technical issues with their application architecture. Communicates best development practices by providing clean, modern working code examples. Onboard new external developers with step-by-step instructions and review of each component to illustrate best practices. Answer development-related questions from external developers. Submit defects or product feedback requests discovered while assisting customers and developers. Coordinate with other teams to triage users to the appropriate team members. Communicate new available APIs to external developers. Exercise sound judgment and make independent decisions. Demonstrate consistent commitment to core company values. Preferred Qualifications Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize based on company and team objectives. Ability to work efficiently under pressure, drive projects to completion and meet deadlines. Flexibility and the ability to adapt quickly to shifting company or team goals. Strong business acumen, including problem-solving and critical thinking. Minimum Qualifications 1 - 2 years of experience with .NET software development using C# and Microsoft SQL Server and in web development using JavaScript, ASP.NET, MVC and/or AJAX. Ability to present complex technological concepts clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical audiences. Thorough understanding of the software development life cycle. At Relativity, we live our core values and we thrive on solving complex problems. We’re dedicated to continually improving our product and providing relentless customer service, and we’re always looking for people to join us on the journey.  Relativity is a team of smart, passionate people always looking to grow, contribute, and make our product and customer service the best it can be. Our team members come from diverse backgrounds with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.  So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Job Description

As a market leader in providing master data management solutions, our Connect Consulting Practice team members engage with our clients to assess and implement best-of-breed applications to address their product, vendor, and customer data needs. Codifyd partners with leading MDM/PIM software vendors including Stibo Systems, Informatica, EnterWorks, and inRiver in delivering these solutions. We are currently looking for a Business Analyst with hands-on experience to gather detailed business and technical requirements, create business use and test cases, and to act as a liaison by creating direct channels of communication between technical and business teams. If you have at least 4 years of relevant professional work experience and strong business analyst experience, this is the opportunity for you.

Responsibilities

Lead in-person discovery meetings with clients and stakeholders to evaluate current PIM/MDM systems and processes along with adapting unique business needs to create and recommend new PIM/MDM solutions.Document components to integrate PIM/MDM solutions with external applicationsDesign and build workflows and custom portal components to enhance governance and quality of product data solutionsDefine test cases and develop and execute test plansDocument business requirement for business processes and abide by those requirements for future projectsCompile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and follow-up on all resultsImplement a comprehensive management plan for each projectHold regular stakeholder meeting to keep all interested parties updated on project progressBuild and maintain long-term client and business partner relationships70-90% Travel Required

Requirements

4+ years of relevant business analyst work experienceStrong Microsoft Visio skillsExperience with both agile and waterfall project formatsStrong experience in user testing and project managementExcellent interpersonal, communication and team-facilitation skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsBachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related major such as electronic engineering; Computer Sciences degree a plus; Masters degree a plus, PIM/MDM experience with major platforms (Stibo, Enterworks, Informatica, inRiver, Infosphere) a plus

About Codifyd

At Codifyd, we transform the way distributors, manufacturers, and retailers leverage the digital landscape. With a product content-centric approach, we create a failsafe system for organizations to manage complex data and information required in todays digital commerce marketplace. Our digital transformation services and AI technologies enable operational efficiency for organizations and their channel partners, while providing a superior research-to-purchase experience for end users and financial growth for sellers.

The Codifyd team is comprised of bright, talented, and experienced professionals working in a fast-paced culture where every team member has autonomy and responsibility. We value innovative thinking, elegant and pragmatic design, exceptional team chemistry, and innate passion to make an impact.

The Business Analyst provides support and administration for all business applications included but not limited to: Dynamics GP environment, EDI, SharePoint, Helpdesk, PowerBI, and Salesforce. The Business Analyst works with Senior Business Process Manager& Vice President of Technology on outside vendor requests to ensure the requests are reviewed and approved to meet budget requirements.

Reporting to the Director of Business Process Improvement, the Dispute Analyst is also responsible for supporting the Director to achieve the objectives of that position. This role requires the ability to work well with all levels within Hub Group and the external customer to ensure dispute resolution and continuous improvement objectives are met. Job DescriptionCompany SummaryTired of looking at the same jobs in the high-tech industry? Have you ever considered working in the wine, beer & spirits industry – well now is your chance! Constellation Brands (NYSE: STZ and STZ.B), a Fortune 500® company, is a leading international producer and marketer of beer, wine, and spirits with operations in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, New Zealand, and Italy.Constellation is the No. 3 beer company in the U.S. with high-end, iconic imported brands such as Corona Extra, Corona Light, Modelo Especial, Modelo Negra and Pacifico. The company’s beer portfolio also includes Funky Buddha, one of the most awarded craft brewers in the U.S. In addition, Constellation is the world’s leader in premium wine, selling great brands that people love, including Robert Mondavi, Kim Crawford, Meiomi and The Prisoner. The company’s premium spirits brands include SVEDKA Vodka, Casa Noble Tequila, and High West Whiskey. We express our company vision: to build brands worth reaching for, and to learn more, visit https://companyprofile.cbrands.com/.Constellation Brands has a flexible work environment that includes the ability to work remotely a few days a week!Position SummaryAs a Product Analyst, Sales Execution you will be the technology and process / functional expert focusing on Field Sales Enablement. You will join the product management team and will collaborate with business stakeholders, distributors, product managers and Agile Teams to define and prioritize new capabilities through user stories, personas, journey maps and UX designs. You will play a critical role in bringing both business and digital thought leadership to the Agile Squads to define and execute Product Roadmaps and measure business value.ResponsibilitiesWork with key business stakeholders and Product Managers to understand goals, enabling capabilities and success measures for digital initiatives.Develop deep knowledge in the Field Sales Enablement process; develop relationships with key business stakeholders to enable feature definition and roadmap execution.Ability to take a holistic product strategy and break it down into detailed requirements and acceptance criteria which can be leveraged by a cross-functional agile team.Work with the product management team to create and maintain core product artifacts including KPI’s, actual product performance vs. KPI’s, product roadmaps, user personas, journey maps, TCO models and product backlog for each product in their portfolio.Define or enhance business processes that improve team execution.Collaborate with other Product Analysts and Product Managers to define and align product roadmaps to ensure ecosystem integrity (mobile execution, planning, reporting, etc.).Utilize Design Thinking and business process modeling techniques to facilitate feature / story definition or UX design. Act as the functional subject matter expert in the assigned functional domain. Define and elaborate on key epics, develop stories and acceptance criteria that are actively managed as part of release planning / story grooming.Define success metrics for key capabilities and releases; on a quarterly basis analyze how the product is performing against key objectives.Accountable for delivery of business value / outcomes from prioritized roadmap items.Engage, educate, and support the super user network for the center of excellence for the specific applications within the defined process area.Qualifications3+ years’ experience in information systems and/or analytical business systems; some technical experience is highly desired, but this role is not a technical role.Product analyst or business process analyst experience in sales, marketing or supply chain is desired.Demonstrated experience supporting Agile squads implementing web / mobile / eCommerce solutions.Experience and familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Rally, JIRA, CI/CD).Strong communication skills in writing, speaking, and presenting.Able to communicate technical or complex subject matter in business terms.Demonstrated track record of creating technology solutions to solve business problems (globally, or across multiple divisions or regions within a single company).High attention to detail is essential.Analytical, problem solver.Education / Experience:Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems or computer science or related field with relevant work experience.3+ years’ experience with digital product strategy, consulting or delivery.Experience working in high-tech, CPG or retail where there is a multi-tier distribution model is preferred.LocationChicago, IllinoisAdditional LocationsJob TypeFull timeJob AreaInformation TechnologyEqual OpportunityConstellation Brands is committed to a continuing program of equal employment opportunity. All persons have equal employment opportunities with Constellation Brands, regardless of their sex, race, color, age, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer or genetic characteristics), marital status, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), familial status, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions (or any other group or category within the framework of the applicable discrimination laws and regulations).

Position Summary:The Cyber Security Risk Analyst will leverage advanced skills to help protect the organization from the activities of cyber criminals. This position will work closely with our Threat & Vulnerability team as well as our Security Incident Response team to help identify and mitigate security risks. This activity will include the coordination of security testing of applications in our portfolio across all business units. This position will also help implement solutions to security standards. Lastly, this position will risk assess security policies and practices of potential new business partners and system vendors that Reyes Holdings Family of Businesses is considering engaging.Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:Interface with IT and our business unit application owners to plan for and execute penetration tests and vulnerability scans.Review testing results and work with application owners to identify needed mitigation of risks identified and appropriate controls.Identify prospective vendors and partners which may require security assessment.Interface with internal business partners considering a potential external product to identify risks.Request security assessment information from prospective vendors and evaluate results and evidence submitted to gauge risks involved.Prepare assessment reports to inform business partner of overall risk presented by the prospective partner and suggest any needed controls.Interface with Engineering, Operations, and Business Units where clarification of security standards is required.Evaluate requests for variance from standard including identification of risks and suitable compensating controls.Follow-up on expiring requests, and report on outstanding requests.Monitoring and addressing supply chain attacks that develop with our existing partnersAny other duties as assignedRequired Skills and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or other IT-related field and 4+ years of experience working in a security risk assessment or security-focused compliance role OR High School Diploma and 7+ years of experience working in a security role involving risk assessment and security testing in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.3+ years of experience with security testing of applications and remediation of discovered weaknesses.3+ years of experience performing risk assessments, preferably third-party vendor assessments. Familiarity with assessment tools such as SIG, VSA, and CAIQ.3+ years of experience with risk assessment methodology such as CIS-RAM.3+ years of experience writing, communicating, or interpreting security standards with an ability to determine applicability of standards to engineering projects, and the insight to identify gaps in standards coverage.2+ years of experience in evaluating, negotiating, and managing an exception process.Ability to interface with a wide range of roles in technical and business capacities.Must possess a willingness to learn, a positive attitude, ambition, high energy, and self-motivation.Strong collaboration skills - able to work in a team-oriented collaborative environment.Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interface with managers, staff, customers, and vendors at all levels within the company.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Strong problem-solving skills - applied skills in critical thinking and analysis, (communications) meeting facilitation, and (collaboration) interpersonal interactions.Strong skills for process and design documentationIn-depth knowledge of application development, PCs, servers, firewalls, TCP/IP & protocols, network admin tools, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, Active Directory, data encryption, and other industry-standard techniques and practices.Travel required up to 10% of the time.This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test.Preferred Skills and Experience:Medium to large global enterprise size environment experienceSecurity-related experience designing/implementing/administering enterprise solutionsFamiliarity with risk assessment frameworks such as NIST RMF, ISO 27005, OCTAVE, or FAIRFamiliarity with audit reports such as SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 certificationFamiliarity with privacy regulation including GDPR, CCPA, PCI-DSS, and HIPAACertified Information Security Manager (CISM)Certified Security Analyst (CSA)Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)AWS, Azure, Cisco Certified Security Professional (CCSP)Physical Demands and Work Environment:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Reyes Holdings companies will recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Our Practices and Procedures, including those relating to wages, benefits, transfers, promotions, terminations and self-development opportunities, will be administered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation and gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status and all other classes protected by the Federal and State Government. Drug Free Employer.

About the Senior Product Data Analyst Position

Job Description

As a market leader in providing master data management solutions, our Connect Consulting Practice team members engage with our clients to assess and implement best-of-breed applications to address their product, vendor, and customer data needs. Codifyd partners with leading MDM/PIM software vendors including Stibo Systems, Informatica, EnterWorks, and inRiver in delivering these solutions. We are currently looking for a Business Analyst with hands-on experience to gather detailed business and technical requirements, create business use and test cases, and to act as a liaison by creating direct channels of communication between technical and business teams. If you have at least 4 years of relevant professional work experience and strong business analyst experience, this is the opportunity for you.

Responsibilities

Lead in-person discovery meetings with clients and stakeholders to evaluate current PIM/MDM systems and processes along with adapting unique business needs to create and recommend new PIM/MDM solutions.Document components to integrate PIM/MDM solutions with external applicationsDesign and build workflows and custom portal components to enhance governance and quality of product data solutionsDefine test cases and develop and execute test plansDocument business requirement for business processes and abide by those requirements for future projectsCompile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and follow-up on all resultsImplement a comprehensive management plan for each projectHold regular stakeholder meeting to keep all interested parties updated on project progressBuild and maintain long-term client and business partner relationships70-90% Travel Required

Requirements

4+ years of relevant business analyst work experienceStrong Microsoft Visio skillsExperience with both agile and waterfall project formatsStrong experience in user testing and project managementExcellent interpersonal, communication and team-facilitation skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsBachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related major such as electronic engineering; Computer Sciences degree a plus; Masters degree a plus, PIM/MDM experience with major platforms (Stibo, Enterworks, Informatica, inRiver, Infosphere) a plus

About Codifyd

At Codifyd, we transform the way distributors, manufacturers, and retailers leverage the digital landscape. With a product content-centric approach, we create a failsafe system for organizations to manage complex data and information required in todays digital commerce marketplace. Our digital transformation services and AI technologies enable operational efficiency for organizations and their channel partners, while providing a superior research-to-purchase experience for end users and financial growth for sellers.

The Codifyd team is comprised of bright, talented, and experienced professionals working in a fast-paced culture where every team member has autonomy and responsibility. We value innovative thinking, elegant and pragmatic design, exceptional team chemistry, and innate passion to make an impact.

Job DescriptionCompany SummaryTired of looking at the same jobs in the high-tech industry? Have you ever considered working in the wine, beer & spirits industry – well now is your chance! Constellation Brands (NYSE: STZ and STZ.B), a Fortune 500® company, is a leading international producer and marketer of beer, wine, and spirits with operations in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, New Zealand, and Italy.Constellation is the No. 3 beer company in the U.S. with high-end, iconic imported brands such as Corona Extra, Corona Light, Modelo Especial, Modelo Negra and Pacifico. The company’s beer portfolio also includes Funky Buddha, one of the most awarded craft brewers in the U.S. In addition, Constellation is the world’s leader in premium wine, selling great brands that people love, including Robert Mondavi, Kim Crawford, Meiomi and The Prisoner. The company’s premium spirits brands include SVEDKA Vodka, Casa Noble Tequila, and High West Whiskey. Position Summary:The Cyber Security Risk Analyst will leverage advanced skills to help protect the organization from the activities of cyber criminals. This position will work closely with our Threat & Vulnerability team as well as our Security Incident Response team to help identify and mitigate security risks. This activity will include the coordination of security testing of applications in our portfolio across all business units. This position will also help implement solutions to security standards. Lastly, this position will risk assess security policies and practices of potential new business partners and system vendors that Reyes Holdings Family of Businesses is considering engaging.Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:Interface with IT and our business unit application owners to plan for and execute penetration tests and vulnerability scans.Review testing results and work with application owners to identify needed mitigation of risks identified and appropriate controls.Identify prospective vendors and partners which may require security assessment.Interface with internal business partners considering a potential external product to identify risks.Request security assessment information from prospective vendors and evaluate results and evidence submitted to gauge risks involved.Prepare assessment reports to inform business partner of overall risk presented by the prospective partner and suggest any needed controls.Interface with Engineering, Operations, and Business Units where clarification of security standards is required.Evaluate requests for variance from standard including identification of risks and suitable compensating controls.Follow-up on expiring requests, and report on outstanding requests.Monitoring and addressing supply chain attacks that develop with our existing partnersAny other duties as assignedRequired Skills and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or other IT-related field and 4+ years of experience working in a security risk assessment or security-focused compliance role OR High School Diploma and 7+ years of experience working in a security role involving risk assessment and security testing in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.3+ years of experience with security testing of applications and remediation of discovered weaknesses.3+ years of experience performing risk assessments, preferably third-party vendor assessments. Familiarity with assessment tools such as SIG, VSA, and CAIQ.3+ years of experience with risk assessment methodology such as CIS-RAM.3+ years of experience writing, communicating, or interpreting security standards with an ability to determine applicability of standards to engineering projects, and the insight to identify gaps in standards coverage.2+ years of experience in evaluating, negotiating, and managing an exception process.Ability to interface with a wide range of roles in technical and business capacities.Must possess a willingness to learn, a positive attitude, ambition, high energy, and self-motivation.Strong collaboration skills - able to work in a team-oriented collaborative environment.Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interface with managers, staff, customers, and vendors at all levels within the company.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Strong problem-solving skills - applied skills in critical thinking and analysis, (communications) meeting facilitation, and (collaboration) interpersonal interactions.Strong skills for process and design documentationIn-depth knowledge of application development, PCs, servers, firewalls, TCP/IP & protocols, network admin tools, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, Active Directory, data encryption, and other industry-standard techniques and practices.Travel required up to 10% of the time.This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test.Preferred Skills and Experience:Medium to large global enterprise size environment experienceSecurity-related experience designing/implementing/administering enterprise solutionsFamiliarity with risk assessment frameworks such as NIST RMF, ISO 27005, OCTAVE, or FAIRFamiliarity with audit reports such as SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 certificationFamiliarity with privacy regulation including GDPR, CCPA, PCI-DSS, and HIPAACertified Information Security Manager (CISM)Certified Security Analyst (CSA)Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)AWS, Azure, Cisco Certified Security Professional (CCSP)Physical Demands and Work Environment:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. About the Senior Product Data Analyst Position

Verndale lives at the intersection of cutting-edge digital marketing technology and award-winning user experience and our goal is to use that knowledge to benefit all of our clients. The Product Data Services team is instrumental in driving this forward with our PIM projects. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Senior Product Data Analyst to join our team on this exciting journey!

In this role, you will be responsible for the oversight and leadership of successful Product Data strategies, solutions and client projects within the PDS practice.

Organize, facilitate, and inform any PIM selection activities including RFI/P's.Organize, plan and facilitate discovery, design, and implementation activities with PDS clients and members of Verndale PDS team.Consult, inform and engage internal, external and client resources in understanding and presenting appropriate options, new and complex paradigms and other options needed to inform necessary scope and business decisions. Provide input and direction to other Verndale/PDS team members to enable their successful contribution aligned to the strategist's experience and solutionAssist Practice Director with practice development

Within client project delivery, the Senior Product Data Analyst is responsible for leading, strategizing and providing team direction for:

Pre-workshop and early engagement preparations and planningWorkshop facilitation and collaboration across PIM projectsOrganizing and mapping client PDS solution needs to be captured in project requirements and technical implementation documentationData Modeling & TaxonomyUser/Admin WorkflowPrint & Additional channel PIM applicationCustomization(s) necessary to complete client solutionsTeam estimations for all project phases of engagement across methodologyImplementation guidance to the larger PDS team as aligned with strategy and vision for optimized solution

Qualifications

5-7 years of demonstrated experience leading and delivering Product Data and Product Information Management solutions/projects8-10 years of professional services and consultative experienceStrong leadership and consultative delivery skills including:


Enterprise Product Data Strategy and multi-phase roadmapsExecutive and Team-Level client facilitation and communicationTechnical and internal delivery-team mentorship and communicationSolution development, scope definition and solution estimation
Strong relationship management skills (team members and clients)


Ability to interact effectively at all levels of an organizationResource motivation and management
Strong domain knowledge and context to understand client models and solutionsB2C/B2B e-commerce and product data experienceStrategic data-base analysis. problem solving and solution development skillsProficient with MS Office Suite, Data visualization and other digital tools & presentation toolsProficient in PDS platforms/tools such as InRiver, Enterworks, Stibo, Syndigo, PDS/Tagglo, TWS and excelDemonstrated experience documenting "as is" and "to be" workflows and processesProven ability to understand, contribute to and work within a structure project delivery methodology including managing billable hour requirements and internal time-trackingStrong written and verbal communication skillsMature work ethic, self starter and collaborative team memberA plus if you have the following:


demonstrated understanding of multi-channel distribution business modelsSpecific domain knowledge/experience with Global Data Synchronization Network/GDSN, TWorldSync, Syndication, Regulatory Standards (Prol 65, CARB, SCAQMB)Past Product Taxonomy experience

About Verndale

Verndale is a customer experience agency, purpose-built to help marketing and technology leaders connect the dots of the consumer journey. From our offices in Boston, Los Angeles and Quito, we design and build digital experiences, and enable marketing technologies that bring brands and their customers closer together.

We know that in order to do great work, you have to make work great. Verndale is committed to always being a company that celebrates diversity, equality and inclusion. We strive to recruit and retain people who are committed to creating the climate of respect that is essential for individual and company success.

Verndales services are built around a core methodology that encompasses Growth Strategy, Experience Design, Technology Enablement, and Experience Optimization.

Learn more at www.verndale.com

Compensation & Benefits

Verndale is proud of the fun, diverse, and respectful company environment we enjoy on a daily basis. Competitive compensation and comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, life, disability and a 401(k) savings plan with company match are offered to all full-time employees. Ample company paid holidays and personal time off make having a work-life balance possible. For some roles working from home on an as-needed basis is a definite possibility; we believe in hiring the best and keeping our own happy and motivated.

Verndale is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Description

As a market leader in providing master data management solutions, our Connect Consulting Practice team members engage with our clients to assess and implement best-of-breed applications to address their product, vendor, and customer data needs. Codifyd partners with leading MDM/PIM software vendors including Stibo Systems, Informatica, EnterWorks, and inRiver in delivering these solutions. We are currently looking for a Business Analyst with hands-on experience to gather detailed business and technical requirements, create business use and test cases, and to act as a liaison by creating direct channels of communication between technical and business teams. If you have at least 4 years of relevant professional work experience and strong business analyst experience, this is the opportunity for you.

Responsibilities

Lead in-person discovery meetings with clients and stakeholders to evaluate current PIM/MDM systems and processes along with adapting unique business needs to create and recommend new PIM/MDM solutions.Document components to integrate PIM/MDM solutions with external applicationsDesign and build workflows and custom portal components to enhance governance and quality of product data solutionsDefine test cases and develop and execute test plansDocument business requirement for business processes and abide by those requirements for future projectsCompile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and follow-up on all resultsImplement a comprehensive management plan for each projectHold regular stakeholder meeting to keep all interested parties updated on project progressBuild and maintain long-term client and business partner relationships70-90% Travel Required

Requirements

4+ years of relevant business analyst work experienceStrong Microsoft Visio skillsExperience with both agile and waterfall project formatsStrong experience in user testing and project managementExcellent interpersonal, communication and team-facilitation skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsBachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related major such as electronic engineering; Computer Sciences degree a plus; Masters degree a plus, PIM/MDM experience with major platforms (Stibo, Enterworks, Informatica, inRiver, Infosphere) a plus

About Codifyd

At Codifyd, we transform the way distributors, manufacturers, and retailers leverage the digital landscape. With a product content-centric approach, we create a failsafe system for organizations to manage complex data and information required in todays digital commerce marketplace. Our digital transformation services and AI technologies enable operational efficiency for organizations and their channel partners, while providing a superior research-to-purchase experience for end users and financial growth for sellers.

The Codifyd team is comprised of bright, talented, and experienced professionals working in a fast-paced culture where every team member has autonomy and responsibility. We value innovative thinking, elegant and pragmatic design, exceptional team chemistry, and innate passion to make an impact.

architectureFamiliar with testing challenges associated with applications developed for cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud or Force.comExposure to DevOps and CI projectsExperience working in a collaborative environmentExperience with work planning, monitoring, and reportingExperience conducting interviews and documenting requirementsExperience facilitating design sessions and defining future state processesStrong oral and written communication skillsA Bachelors Degree in a relevant field, technology, engineering is strongly preferred.How youll growAt Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe theres always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.BenefitsAt Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.Deloittes cultureOur positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Analyze and manage business requirements throughout the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including support of requirements workshops, business process modeling, writing detailed functional specifications for new and changed complex information systems, preparing test cases and testing strategies, conducting peer reviews to ensure 'as-built' information systems conform to specifications, and ensuring that processes are followed. Additionally, participate with analysis of business requirements and recommend effective, efficient, flexible technical solutions to meet business needs. Perform work within the full range of project development methodologies, including: waterfall and Agile methods. Assist with leading and facilitating groups across all levels of the organization to deliver valued outcomes, including improved analytics, adoption of improved methodologies, and using analytics to drive business decisionsRESPONSIBILITIESRelease Planning and daily operations - 50% oElicit, analyze, and document requirements by communicating directly with customers to resolve complex issues oGroom and maintain backlog with prioritized user stories oPlan and monitor the progress of release items oUnderstand issues and help resolve them through data analysis, technical research, and team collaboration on complex issues oAssist with connecting processes and overcoming internal silos oEnhance the end user experience by providing actionable information oFacilitate user acceptance testing and perform integration testing, as required oOther activities within area of responsibility, as neededProjects - 40% oCommunicate effectively with all team members, stakeholders and project sponsors on technical and non-technical topics oDevelop elements of systems design, including user stories, business process documentation, workflow charts, diagrams, data migration rules, business rules, wireframes, or other detailed deliverables oStrive toward continual optimization across processes using technology to solve issues, increase efficiency, and add to the bottom line oUse new technologies to leverage possibilities and opportunities to innovate the future through the interconnectivity of devices and processes oAchieve core business competencies in rapidly changing environments by using innovative technology oIdentify controls necessary to ensure long-term system stability oCreate test plans and strategy oCollaborate with end users and developers on developing comprehensive test cases oAssists in the development of training material. Conducts training as appropriateStrategy and R&D - 10% oInvestigate and make recommendations on emerging technologies oUnderstand enterprise strategy and direction oKeep the end user/customer at the forefront of thought; support, guide, influence users to see opportunities and value with new approaches using technology oAssist users with realizing their strategy and goals through the use of new technologyQUALIFICATIONSInnate curiosity about technology and how technology can solve problemsStrong business acumen; ability to understand business models quicklyAct as a liaison with the Digital Governance, Risk and Security team to comply with digital governance and security policies and standards during design and implementationBe a champion of digital security at TTXDemonstrated self-starter; strong initiativeAbility to manage and focus on multiple tasks and changing prioritiesBachelor's degree in technology, programming, or businessMinimum 3 years of experience as a BAMinimum 5 years professional experience with demonstrated progressive responsibilityExperience using agile methodologies such as Scrum or KanbanExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to create wire frames; leveraging intuitive designStrong MS Office skillsIntermediate experience using SQL or other programming languagesKnowledge of all phases of the Software Development Life CyclePHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS(The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to move about (stand, walk) and reach with hands and arms. Tampico Beverages, a growing multi-national company with corporate offices in Chicago, has an immediate opportunity for Business Analyst

ABOUT US:Bottling Irresistible– Discover Flavors of Fun!

Here at Tampico, we are constantly striving to create moments of joy for our consumers through our products and an awesome culture to our employees! Besides being one of the top selling brands of Refrigerated Juice Drinks available in groceries across America and around the world, we are a team of dedicated people focused on bringing our consumers the best tasting, highest quality products at the best value. Please visit our website at www.tampico.com for more information.

Our dedicated and inquisitive team is behind everything we do, we are always improving. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits such as vacation, health, dental, vision, life insurance, short/long-term disability, employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, wellness program, ESOP, and the option to participate in the company’s 401K plan. We can only imagine what the future holds, but we know it will be irresistible.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Business Analyst provides support and administration for all business applications included but not limited to: Dynamics GP environment, EDI, SharePoint, Helpdesk, PowerBI, and Salesforce. They are responsible to analyze user requests and issues for business applications and determine if requests or issues can be done internally or by applicable vendor. The Business Analyst works with Senior Business Process Manager& Vice President of Technology on outside vendor requests to ensure the requests are reviewed and approved to meet budget requirements.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Support and administer the following software: Dynamics GP, Salesforce, SharePoint, POS Site, Spiceworks and PowerBISupport& grow with EDI Prioritize and ensure Helpdesk tickets are addressed in a timely mannerDevelop and report timelines and project statuesManage projects and request costs against budget expenditures


QUALIFICATIONS:

7 years of experience working with in Dynamics GP; 5 years of experience with MS SQL; EDI, PowerBI and Salesforce experience a plusBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Business - requiredProficient in Microsoft Office Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skillsAbility to organize and manage multiple projectsIdeal place of residence: Chicago, IL or surrounding suburbs

NOTE: Relocation is not provided for this position. No phone calls please

Job Summary: The Dispute Analyst is responsible for resolution of disputed accounts receivable balances. This role is responsible to meet time bound targets as established by management. Reporting to the Director of Business Process Improvement, the Dispute Analyst is also responsible for supporting the Director to achieve the objectives of that position. This role requires the ability to work well with all levels within Hub Group and the external customer to ensure dispute resolution and continuous improvement objectives are met. Through effective internal and external communication, this position supports company billing, collection, and cash application goals while providing stellar customer service. The Dispute Analyst will also provide general customer support when requesting information or addressing various standard inquiries.Essential Job Functions: Analyze dispute cases, draw conclusions based on findings, and clearly summarize the results of the investigationThis includes assertively pursuing resolution of the dispute(s) while maintaining positive stakeholder relationshipsLiaise with Billing Department, Collections, Cash Application, and other Hub Group functional areas to support dispute resolution effortsPerform account reconciliations as part of the dispute resolution effortIncluding audits of certain types of company billing as may be directed by managementProvide Collection Specialists with supporting documentation they will need to facilitate customer paymentDocument dispute resolution efforts in ERP, including: conversations, e-mails and other communications related to the analysis/investigation in order to assist with any follow up effortsEscalate collection concerns, issues, risks, etc. pursuant to established company guidelinesAssist with training and developing new team members as assigned by managementDevelop and maintain quality relationships with Sales, Account Managers, Credit Analysts, Collection Specialists, Cash Application Specialists, and Invoicing team membersPerform special projects and other duties as may be assigned from time to time by managementMinimum Qualifications: High School Diploma/GED required. Job DescriptionCompany SummaryTired of looking at the same jobs in the high-tech industry? Have you ever considered working in the wine, beer & spirits industry – well now is your chance! Constellation Brands (NYSE: STZ and STZ.B), a Fortune 500® company, is a leading international producer and marketer of beer, wine, and spirits with operations in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, New Zealand, and Italy.Constellation is the No. 3 beer company in the U.S. with high-end, iconic imported brands such as Corona Extra, Corona Light, Modelo Especial, Modelo Negra and Pacifico. The company’s beer portfolio also includes Funky Buddha, one of the most awarded craft brewers in the U.S. In addition, Constellation is the world’s leader in premium wine, selling great brands that people love, including Robert Mondavi, Kim Crawford, Meiomi and The Prisoner. The company’s premium spirits brands include SVEDKA Vodka, Casa Noble Tequila, and High West Whiskey. We express our company vision: to build brands worth reaching for, and to learn more, visit https://companyprofile.cbrands.com/.Constellation Brands has a flexible work environment that includes the ability to work remotely a few days a week!Position SummaryAs a Product Analyst, Sales Execution you will be the technology and process / functional expert focusing on Field Sales Enablement. You will join the product management team and will collaborate with business stakeholders, distributors, product managers and Agile Teams to define and prioritize new capabilities through user stories, personas, journey maps and UX designs. You will play a critical role in bringing both business and digital thought leadership to the Agile Squads to define and execute Product Roadmaps and measure business value.ResponsibilitiesWork with key business stakeholders and Product Managers to understand goals, enabling capabilities and success measures for digital initiatives.Develop deep knowledge in the Field Sales Enablement process; develop relationships with key business stakeholders to enable feature definition and roadmap execution.Ability to take a holistic product strategy and break it down into detailed requirements and acceptance criteria which can be leveraged by a cross-functional agile team.Work with the product management team to create and maintain core product artifacts including KPI’s, actual product performance vs. KPI’s, product roadmaps, user personas, journey maps, TCO models and product backlog for each product in their portfolio.Define or enhance business processes that improve team execution.Collaborate with other Product Analysts and Product Managers to define and align product roadmaps to ensure ecosystem integrity (mobile execution, planning, reporting, etc.).Utilize Design Thinking and business process modeling techniques to facilitate feature / story definition or UX design. Act as the functional subject matter expert in the assigned functional domain. Define and elaborate on key epics, develop stories and acceptance criteria that are actively managed as part of release planning / story grooming.Define success metrics for key capabilities and releases; on a quarterly basis analyze how the product is performing against key objectives.Accountable for delivery of business value / outcomes from prioritized roadmap items.Engage, educate, and support the super user network for the center of excellence for the specific applications within the defined process area.Qualifications3+ years’ experience in information systems and/or analytical business systems; some technical experience is highly desired, but this role is not a technical role.Product analyst or business process analyst experience in sales, marketing or supply chain is desired.Demonstrated experience supporting Agile squads implementing web / mobile / eCommerce solutions.Experience and familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Rally, JIRA, CI/CD).Strong communication skills in writing, speaking, and presenting.Able to communicate technical or complex subject matter in business terms.Demonstrated track record of creating technology solutions to solve business problems (globally, or across multiple divisions or regions within a single company).High attention to detail is essential.Analytical, problem solver.Education / Experience:Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems or computer science or related field with relevant work experience.3+ years’ experience with digital product strategy, consulting or delivery.Experience working in high-tech, CPG or retail where there is a multi-tier distribution model is preferred.LocationChicago, IllinoisAdditional LocationsJob TypeFull timeJob AreaInformation TechnologyEqual OpportunityConstellation Brands is committed to a continuing program of equal employment opportunity. All persons have equal employment opportunities with Constellation Brands, regardless of their sex, race, color, age, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer or genetic characteristics), marital status, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), familial status, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions (or any other group or category within the framework of the applicable discrimination laws and regulations).

Position Summary:The Cyber Security Risk Analyst will leverage advanced skills to help protect the organization from the activities of cyber criminals. This position will work closely with our Threat & Vulnerability team as well as our Security Incident Response team to help identify and mitigate security risks. This activity will include the coordination of security testing of applications in our portfolio across all business units. This position will also help implement solutions to security standards. Lastly, this position will risk assess security policies and practices of potential new business partners and system vendors that Reyes Holdings Family of Businesses is considering engaging.Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:Interface with IT and our business unit application owners to plan for and execute penetration tests and vulnerability scans.Review testing results and work with application owners to identify needed mitigation of risks identified and appropriate controls.Identify prospective vendors and partners which may require security assessment.Interface with internal business partners considering a potential external product to identify risks.Request security assessment information from prospective vendors and evaluate results and evidence submitted to gauge risks involved.Prepare assessment reports to inform business partner of overall risk presented by the prospective partner and suggest any needed controls.Interface with Engineering, Operations, and Business Units where clarification of security standards is required.Evaluate requests for variance from standard including identification of risks and suitable compensating controls.Follow-up on expiring requests, and report on outstanding requests.Monitoring and addressing supply chain attacks that develop with our existing partnersAny other duties as assignedRequired Skills and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or other IT-related field and 4+ years of experience working in a security risk assessment or security-focused compliance role OR High School Diploma and 7+ years of experience working in a security role involving risk assessment and security testing in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.3+ years of experience with security testing of applications and remediation of discovered weaknesses.3+ years of experience performing risk assessments, preferably third-party vendor assessments. Familiarity with assessment tools such as SIG, VSA, and CAIQ.3+ years of experience with risk assessment methodology such as CIS-RAM.3+ years of experience writing, communicating, or interpreting security standards with an ability to determine applicability of standards to engineering projects, and the insight to identify gaps in standards coverage.2+ years of experience in evaluating, negotiating, and managing an exception process.Ability to interface with a wide range of roles in technical and business capacities.Must possess a willingness to learn, a positive attitude, ambition, high energy, and self-motivation.Strong collaboration skills - able to work in a team-oriented collaborative environment.Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interface with managers, staff, customers, and vendors at all levels within the company.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Strong problem-solving skills - applied skills in critical thinking and analysis, (communications) meeting facilitation, and (collaboration) interpersonal interactions.Strong skills for process and design documentationIn-depth knowledge of application development, PCs, servers, firewalls, TCP/IP & protocols, network admin tools, intrusion detection systems, anti-virus software, Active Directory, data encryption, and other industry-standard techniques and practices.Travel required up to 10% of the time.This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test.Preferred Skills and Experience:Medium to large global enterprise size environment experienceSecurity-related experience designing/implementing/administering enterprise solutionsFamiliarity with risk assessment frameworks such as NIST RMF, ISO 27005, OCTAVE, or FAIRFamiliarity with audit reports such as SOC 2 Type II and ISO 27001 certificationFamiliarity with privacy regulation including GDPR, CCPA, PCI-DSS, and HIPAACertified Information Security Manager (CISM)Certified Security Analyst (CSA)Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)AWS, Azure, Cisco Certified Security Professional (CCSP)Physical Demands and Work Environment:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Reyes Holdings companies will recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications. Our Practices and Procedures, including those relating to wages, benefits, transfers, promotions, terminations and self-development opportunities, will be administered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation and gender identity, age, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status and all other classes protected by the Federal and State Government. Drug Free Employer.

Verndale lives at the intersection of cutting-edge digital marketing technology and award-winning user experience and our goal is to use that knowledge to benefit all of our clients. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Senior Product Data Analyst to join our team on this exciting journey!

Enterprise Product Data Strategy and multi-phase roadmapsExecutive and Team-Level client facilitation and communicationTechnical and internal delivery-team mentorship and communicationSolution development, scope definition and solution estimation
Strong relationship management skills (team members and clients)


Ability to interact effectively at all levels of an organizationResource motivation and management
Strong domain knowledge and context to understand client models and solutionsB2C/B2B e-commerce and product data experienceStrategic data-base analysis. problem solving and solution development skillsProficient with MS Office Suite, Data visualization and other digital tools & presentation toolsProficient in PDS platforms/tools such as InRiver, Enterworks, Stibo, Syndigo, PDS/Tagglo, TWS and excelDemonstrated experience documenting "as is" and "to be" workflows and processesProven ability to understand, contribute to and work within a structure project delivery methodology including managing billable hour requirements and internal time-trackingStrong written and verbal communication skillsMature work ethic, self starter and collaborative team memberA plus if you have the following:


demonstrated understanding of multi-channel distribution business modelsSpecific domain knowledge/experience with Global Data Synchronization Network/GDSN, TWorldSync, Syndication, Regulatory Standards (Prol 65, CARB, SCAQMB)Past Product Taxonomy experience

Verndale is a customer experience agency, purpose-built to help marketing and technology leaders connect the dots of the consumer journey. From our offices in Boston, Los Angeles and Quito, we design and build digital experiences, and enable marketing technologies that bring brands and their customers closer together.

We know that in order to do great work, you have to make work great. Verndale is committed to always being a company that celebrates diversity, equality and inclusion. We strive to recruit and retain people who are committed to creating the climate of respect that is essential for individual and company success.

Verndales services are built around a core methodology that encompasses Growth Strategy, Experience Design, Technology Enablement, and Experience Optimization.

Learn more at www.verndale.com

Compensation & Benefits

Verndale is proud of the fun, diverse, and respectful company environment we enjoy on a daily basis. Ample company paid holidays and personal time off make having a work-life balance possible. For some roles working from home on an as-needed basis is a definite possibility; we believe in hiring the best and keeping our own happy and motivated.
